Machine Girl is an American electronic music project created in 2012 by Matt Stephenson in Long Island, New York. In 2015, the project became a duo, with Stephenson recruiting percussionist Sean Kelly to play live drums. The project derives its name from the 2008 Japanese film The Machine Girl and has occasionally incorporated samples from the film into their work, notably in their 2014 debut studio album, WLFGRL.

data.text:
Up Next

Similar to what you are listening to

Machine Girl is an American electronic music project created in 2012 by Matt Stephenson in Long Island, New York. In 2015, the project became a duo, with Stephenson recruiting percussionist Sean Kelly to play live drums. The project derives its name from the 2008 Japanese film The Machine Girl and has occasionally incorporated samples from the film into their work, notably in their 2014 debut studio album, WLFGRL.

Machine Girl, as described by its creator, is a genre-defying musical project characterized as "fucked-up electronic punk". Stephenson rejected the label of "industrial", deeming it too gothic and monochromatic, preferring to view the project as more colorfulâ€¦.
